extension_description.message: Suggests folder for a bookmark using predefined rules

help_dialog_create_rule_step1.message: Click on FAB button (circle button with a plus sign)

help_dialog_create_rule_step2.message: Click on "Select folder" button and select bookmark folder

help_dialog_create_rule_step3_hint1.message: Expressions operation is a logical conjunction - expressions are AND-ed.

help_dialog_create_rule_step3_1.message: Set expression type - "URL starts with", "Title contains" and etc.

help_dialog_create_rule_step3_2.message: Set expression value - URL or part of the URL or part of the Title

help_dialog_create_rule_step3_2_example.message: For example if you want to select any page with URL containing "JavaScript" and on "https://developer.mozilla.org" site - you need to set

help_dialog_create_rule_for_page_header.message: Create a rule for current page

help_dialog_create_rule_for_page.message: You can add a rule for current the page by clicking on "Add rule" button inside browse action popup. Page title and url is copied to a new rule as expression values. If the page is already bookmarked the bookmark's folder will be copied to rule.

help_dialog_expression_types_type1.message: URL starts with - matches URLs starting with specified value (e.g. "http://www.bbc.com/news/video_and_audio/")

help_dialog_expression_types_type2.message: URL is on domain - matches URLs within specified domain (e.g. "www.bbc.com")

help_dialog_expression_types_type3.message: URL contains - matches URLs containing specified value (e.g. "rss")

help_dialog_expression_types_type4.message: Title contains - matches pages with url containing specified substring
